p: Dengue is a notifiable communicable disease in Taiwan and a national web-based notifiable diseases surveillance system has been established since 1997. All confirmation laboratory tests are performed at the Centers for Disease Control (CDC), Ministry of Health and Welfare, Taiwan [ 18â€“ 20]. However, no seroprevalence study of dengue in Taiwan has been reported since 1989 [ 21]. Therefore, in this study, we conducted a DENV seroprevalence study in two districts of Kaohsiung City, one (Sanmin district) with high case numbers and the other (Nanzih district) with low case numbers during recent outbreaks.
